results.title: When gold is green
results.brief_description: Gives a detailed picture of the care associated with tobacco growing in Ontario. Harvested by hand, typed, cured and baled by grade, the crop is marketed, and then stored for 1-3 years before being blended, cut and dehumidified during the highly mechanized process of cigarette manufacture.

results.title: Whatever
results.creator_credit: Susan Skoog, Ellin Baumel, Kevin Segalla and Michelle Yahn
results.brief_description: ‘Whatever’ is a coming-of-age film set in the mundane suburbia of New Jersey in the early 1980s. Anna (Liza Weill) hopes she will never be ordinary. Her dream is to escape to an art school in New York. Brenda, (Chad Morgan) her best friend, is both an exciting companion and a destructive force. Together they explore sex, drugs and rock’n roll, their experiences often proving less than positive. Anna comes to realise that the road to adulthood can involve some hard decisions, and that friendships can’t always last forever. With a soundtrack that includes Blondie, The Ramones, Motorhead and The Patti Smith Group, ‘Whatever’ portrays a gritty slice of suburban teenage life.

results.title: What, where and when
results.creator_credit: Denis Shand and The Gan Council
results.brief_description: Sounds hints for housewives: How to buy fish and meat, what makes a balanced meal, using the fridge and storing vegetables, cooking utensils and various hints on all matters dealing with the work of the housewife in the kitchen. No 1 of a Cookery Series suitable for women’s groups and domestic science classes.

results.title: What you ought to want
results.brief_description: Bishop G. Bromley Oxnam addresses a group of young people on the subject, “How do you tell right from wrong?” He points to the basic facets in our heritage of history and of faith which can be used to measure the effects of choices one makes. He demonstrates ways in which the best of science, history, poetry, drama and religion can be brought to bear on decisions which may touch not only one’s own personality but those of others in the family, community, nation and world.

results.title: What to do with a dollar
results.brief_description: The State Savings Bank is closely linked with the development of Victoria. It seeks to use the dollars at its disposal for the maximum benefit of the people of Victoria. Through loan money it helps provide power, water suppl7, roads, port facilities, housing loans and rural loans.

results.title: What price water
results.creator_credit: David Cons, G. Buckland-Smith and GBS Productions
results.brief_description: Britain is the leading exporter of desalination plants. All over the world plants are providing fresh water for consumption by industry, agriculture and in the home. Details the extensive research and development programmes on a number of techniques: multi-stage flash distillation, electrodialysis, reverse osmosis and freezing.

results.title: What now?
results.creator_credit: Mark Nebauer, Pregnancy Problem Centre and True Colours Productions
results.brief_description: Using real interviews and mock footage, this short film explores the issue of unwanted pregnancy with a slight slant towards pro-choice. Marion, Linda and Jody, three women of varying ages and from different backgrounds, talk candidly of what it was like to find themselves unexpectedly pregnant, the choices they made; abortion, adoption, keeping the baby, and how it has affected their lives today. Doctor Carolyn Russell discusses the emotional and physical phases of pregnancy as well as a brief overview of what goes on in an abortion. A guide accompanies the video to promote discussion.

results.title: What do you mean I've changed?: journeys through post-natal depression
results.brief_description: One in five women suffer from Post-natal depression (PND). In this short documentary, 3 women; Cindy Picton-Barnes, Susan King and Sandi Avery frankly discuss their experiences with PND - the physical and mental symptoms, self-doubt, fear and anxiety, and the treatment they found most effective. Also includes discussion with the womens’ partners and an expert from the Dona Maria Pre and Post-natal Support Network who outlines where women can go for help as well as what factors contribute to PND. Presented by Wendy Harmer, Patron of Dona Maria Post-Natal Support Network.

results.title: What do I know about Benny?
results.brief_description: Benny is achieving low grades in school and his discipline is poor. His mother discuses the situation with the school principal. The principal attempts to explain that Benny was achieving up to his ability level. The mother rejects this and blames his performance on bad teaching.
